title: Monthly reminder that Thornmail is still useless if you aren't Taric, Rammus or Malphite
body:
Tbh I don't even see any difference in damage done with thornmail.
ADCs outheal thorns with just vampiric scepter...

#best (ADC) meta ever!

http://www.ripthelifeiknew.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/pinata.jpg

Report Hecarim for feeding Lee.


EDIT:

I get lots of comments such as "I built thornmail on X and i'm PRO.
Yea great. I won as AP Irelia with best score & damage in my team.
But it was just luck of a day to fight against such team on those conditions.

yup. they used those 3 as a baseline for the effectiveness of the item for some reason. if you cant get 500 armor and upwards, thornmail has 0 effect beyond the stats it grants.

and since 1300 gold last whisper is a thing now, investing into big items that only grant armor is a trap. your opponent can already grab a last whisper and make 30% of its armor useless while youre still trying to finish your thronmail.

they need to change the scaling of the passive to scale off resistances in general, so it can be decent on everyone without being op on those 3.


increase the damage return by 5% and lower the armor scaling of the flat damage returned just slightly. then add mr scaling to it.

so the item isnt unproportionally stronger on champions who can stack excessive amounts of armor, than on regular fighters and tanks.

Eh I'd like to see Thornmail become the anti on-hit item, to counter all these {{item:3931}} + {{item:3124}} champs. To do this make it more like Rammus W, where it has a flat return on-hit, then have that value scale with damage taken. Suddenly Yi will start paying for all those ghost hits he gets.
And then watch {{champion:33}} get nerfed to the ground so hard his relationship with it will look intimate to {{champion:421}}

Im still waiting for people to realize this
What about Shen?  He has a taunt, shouldn't he get Thornmail too?
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UfOqXFcycB8/hqdefault.jpg

I haven't ever played Shen outside of aram, so I am honestly curious here: why isn't it a good buy for him?  He's naturally tanky, and since he has a taunt move, he might as well exploit it.  It seems like a good idea to me.

His taunt last too short and Shen isn't as tanky anymore (forced to build some damage)

If you need thornmail, then it's better to go full damage as Shen. You'll kill them alot quicker.
Thornmail will just make u into bloody mess after 2 seconds of fight.
His W blocks autos which is what you usually use in his combo so I believe it will not proc damage from thornmail
Okay, that makes sense.
But Nasus {{champion:75}} is op with thornmail {{item:3075}} and visage {{item:3065}}

yea, and sandwitch is op with beer.

everything depends on situation. But in my experience tornmail I bough didn't make me tankier, didn't punish 3 ADCs i faced it just was in my item slot. I could have bought second pair of boots for the same effect.

You know... Why don't they replace the extra {{item:1029}} in the recipe with a {{item:1033}} and change the final stats to 80 armor and 30 MR? They already decided to make it "better against on hit builds" so why not give it some resistance to the magic damage on hit builds deal to you? Would make it a better alrounder item too.

Imho:

I am fine thornmail having 100 armor with no other stats
I am fine with its cost

I am not fine with useless passive that is negated by:
- life steal
- mixed damage (kayle/kog/corki/WW/Yi are IMMUNE to thornmail)

Make thornmail return from all types of damage.
AD -> returns ap dmg
AP -> returns AD dmg
Both at 40%.

A friend of mine, a diamond master Yi player, recently told me how deadly thornmail is to master Yi. If two takes take it, he can no longer penta kill. rip

Anyway... thornmail's damage is supposed to make that lifesteal on ADCs less effective. But mostly, I think the large amount of base armor it gives for such a low price is it's primary use. I like thornmail's passive, but I rarely buy it for primarily its passive.

 I think the only thing thornmail might need is a slight buff to the damage on its passive, and maybe have it give us 120 armor instead. Frozen Heart gives 90 (used to be 100), but it also gives us CDR, mana, and the AS slow passive. That AS slow probably weakens people attacking you, including on hit champions, more than thornmail. It's more expensive, but as the game gets to the late stages, it's probably more efficient in your item slot. 

I like thornmail's cost effectiveness. I can purchase thornmail, zzrot, then banshee's and SV or Maw of Mal against a magic damage comp (still has an ADC), mr boots of course. Although, frozen heart would be more useful more than likely, you'd still rather have health...

Dead man's plate is so powerful because of that, it gives movespeed, armor, and health. Health protects you from everything, including true damage. Thornmail has never seemed as bad as people are saying it is. When the situation calls for frozen heart and thornmail because the enemy team has 4 AD champs... then it will shine. Like most items, everything is situational.

> I think the only thing thornmail might need is a slight buff to the damage on its passive, and maybe have it give us 120 armor instead.

I don't wanna be rude, but by writing this you clearly show you have no idea what's wrong with thornmail.

Riot gimped this passive while serving us some weird twisted logic like "it's all fine cause we know what it'll do".. And Guess what? They didn't know what they did :|

I'm aware they changed the passive. 

Just hasn't really made much of a difference for me. I have thornmail as an option for what thornmail is good at. That's about it. 

Looks like it'll return 100-250 damage depending on how much damage the ADC is doing and how much armor you have. It's probably not as strong as it used to be. It used to be 30% of the damage inflicted. It's impossible for that 25% of bonus armor to actually make up for another 15% of an ADC's damage, but I'm sure it's still an effective way to combat lifesteal. (Most ADCs will have botrk and bloodthirster for most of their lifesteal, so this helps to even the fight, and the 100 armor alone already reduces their damage to you by a massive amount). 

Does this damage apply to crits too?

any champ that autoattack IS NOT IMMUNE to thornmail. Kayle/kog/corki/yi/ww are perfect example of champions that ARE NOT immune to thornmail, also Kayle and yi do not build any lifesteal. Thornmail does damage based on enemy attack and your own armor. You know who is really immune to thornmail? Any ap or ad caster that doesn't apply on hits with their abilities.

By "immune" I mean that (almost) half of champions AA damage isn't registered for thornmail because it's either MAGIC damage or TRUE damage.


Just cause you haven't met Kayle or Yi building lifesteal, doesn't mean EVERY Kayle/Yi don't build it. So don't act cocky.

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/uncyclopedia/images/7/72/Orly.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20081126173842

(that's the part why Thornmail SUCKS BALLS)

Thornmail is fine, it's just a less brainless item now. You can't just get it and expect to nearly kill the enemy ADC by doing literally nothing. Now you have to actually do some damage of your own towards them. It's still strong on the champs mentioned, as well as Dr. Mundo, Nasus, Shyvana, Volibear, Amumu, etc.

I swear, it's almost like you people want to outdamage an ADC's lifesteal with a single cheap purchase or something (I'm joking, I know that is *exactly* what you clowns want).

> Thornmail is fine, it's just a less brainless item now.

Cause stacking 400+ armor is so hard on brain..

>ADCs outheal thorns with just vampiric scepter...

Incorrect, 99% of ADC also take life steal masteries and often runes, yet still require higher levels of life steal to over heal the damage from Thornmail.  Thornmail is designed to be more efficient than life steal.

Life steal is calculated from the actual damage done to an enemy, after armor and all other forms of damage reduction.

{{item:3075}} Reflects 15% of the physical damage taken (+ 25% bonus armor) from basic attacks and on-hit effects back to its source as magic damage (Calculated before any resistances or reductions are taken into account).

>Report Hecarim for feeding Lee.

Report Hec for building troll.  Of all the items that work on him Thornmail is one of the poorest you can buy.

>Thornmail is still useless

I think it's overnerfed, but hardly useless.  I've pondered how to give it some added power without just going backwards or going in a direction that Riot has stated they don't feel good with.  

Honestly, I've pondered if there is a way to give Thornmail some MagPen...
